snippet: Alton Grizzard, the acclaimed Navy quarterback who set team career records for total offense from 1987 to 1990, and Kerry O'Neill, a 1993 Naval Academy graduate who set records in women's track, were shot to death by a fellow Academy graduate at a...
lead_paragraph: Alton Grizzard, the acclaimed Navy quarterback who set team career records for total offense from 1987 to 1990, and Kerry O'Neill, a 1993 Naval Academy graduate who set records in women's track, were shot to death by a fellow Academy graduate at a California naval base early yesterday in what the police described as a possible love triangle. The gunman, George Smith, a 24-year-old Navy ensign from Huntington Beach, Calif., killed himself after shooting Grizzard and O'Neill, the police in Coronado, Calif., said. Smith was trained to work aboard nuclear-powered submarines, according to a Navy spokesman, Lieut. Comdr. Frank Thorp.

headline.main: Two Former Navy Athletes Killed by Fellow Graduate
